result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 12/31/2016.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil jdugment to be entered.
Fine is set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Release for inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry T Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Terry T Johnson
Current: 2211 N 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 02-20-2017)
Prior: 2207 N. 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender - 819 N 6th St.).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant Terry T Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Terry T Johnson in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 15
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case spun to branch 17, Judge Stark. File taken to branch 17.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Terry T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/11/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Terry T Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Terry T Johnson in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terry T Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  
Defendant Terry T Johnson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
